topic.title: Getting Started with Centralized Logging Service

body.p: A typical cloud consists of multiple servers which makes locating a specific log from a single server difficult. The Centralized Logging feature helps the administrator evaluate and troubleshoot the distributed cloud deployment from a single location.

body.p: The Centralized Logging feature collects logs on a central system, rather than leaving the logs scattered across the network. The administrator can use a single interface to view log information in charts, graphs, tables, histograms, and other forms.
